subject: Re: coverage testing
msgSnippet: ... Inspired by this conversation, I ran a coverage tool on a toy project of mine last night. The coverage in one package had dropped from 99% to 83% in a few
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
>
> Eugene Kuleshov wrote:
> > There is only one step left before template pattern, so you can have
> > exactly one place where that exception handler would be used.

Inspired by this conversation, I ran a coverage tool on a toy project
of mine last night. The coverage in one package had dropped from 99%
to 83% in a few days. I extracted a common superclass to eliminate the
duplication. Coverage happy again.

Just because coverage can be misused, doesn't make it useless.

I blogged : http://tinyurl.com/9vv6c

Kevin
